text: Nina Foch (April 20, 1924 â€“ December 5, 2008) was a Dutch-American actress. She was the leading lady in many movies in the 1940s and 1950s. She played Marie Antoinette in Scaramouche (1952). She also played Erica Martin in the movie Executive Suite. Foch was born in Leiden, Netherlands to an American mother and Dutch father. She died of kidney disease in Los Angeles. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2008 deaths Category:Actors from Los Angeles Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:Disease-related deaths in Los Angeles Category:Deaths from kidney disease Category:People from Leiden
title: Nina Foch
